snippet: While the report included “troubling” findings regarding the targeting of Muslims, Police Department officials said they felt vindicated and were given a “clean bill of health.”...
abstract: New York Police Department Inspector General's office report finds intelligence-gathering rules were frequently broken by police targeting Muslims for surveillance after September 11 attacks; also concludes police acted properly in choosing targets of investigation, drawing praise from some officials.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and RICK ROJAS

lead_paragraph: While the report included “troubling” findings regarding the targeting of Muslims, Police Department officials said they felt vindicated and were given a “clean bill of health.”

headline.main: New York Police Broke Surveillance Rules After 9/11, Inquiry Finds
headline.print_headline: Police Broke Surveillance Rules After 9/11, Inquiry Finds
